resources.string: Blacklist: 0 domains | Whitelist: 0 domains and 0 apps
Blacklist: %1$d domains | Whitelist: %2$d domains and %3$d apps
Mobile data: 0 apps | Wi-Fi data: 0 apps | Custom: 0 apps
Mobile data: %1$d apps | Wi-Fi data: %2$d apps | Custom: %3$d apps
Adhell3 is not yet supported on your device.
To enable adhell3, you must activate admin mode for this app. \nAdhell3 uses Knox APIs which require device administrator permission.
Adhell3 utilizes Knox SDK which requires a KPE key. \nKPE Development Limited cannot be used as it doesn\'t have needed permissions.
Your device is not connected to the Internet.
Whitelist domains to bypass the firewall. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disable all features and uninstall adhell3
Do you really want to uninstall adhell3 and enable all disabled apps?
Edit DNS only if you know the issues it can cause. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Blacklist domains or define firewall denial rules. \nToggle Domain rules to apply domain changes. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply firewall changes.

Firewall rule format: 
	packageName|ipAddress|port 
E.g. block port 53 for every IP in Chrome: 
	com.android.chrome|*|53
Domains support wildcards, e.g. *facebook.com \nDomain rule format for a specific app: \n\tpackageName|domain

To add hosts file from a cloud storage, you need to install the cloud provider app. 
You will find the cloud providers listed on the left hand side of the file picker. 
 
To refresh the hosts file from a cloud storage: 
You need first to refresh the folder in the cloud provider app and then swipe down the provider list.

This will enable all apps' components. 
Samsung Knox doesn't have an API to clear disabled components. 
Therefore, if they are still disabled after this operation, you need to uninstall adhell3 to enable them. 

Do you really want to enable all apps' components?
Beware when disabling SYSTEM apps\' components. You might end up with a factory reset!
Do you really want to apply or remove custom DNS for all apps? \nApplying custom DNS to all apps might cause your internet connection to malfunction.
Add the selected domain to your whitelist?
Adhell3 needs a storage access to function properly. \nPick a folder where Adhell3 will read or write files from it.
DNS addresses have been set. Toggle Domain rules to apply changes.
DNS has been restored to defaults. Toggle Domain rules to apply changes.
In addition to adhell3\'s standard package, you can add links to remote and local hosts lists. \nAdhell3 can block up to %1$d unique domains. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disabling system apps may cause the device to malfunction. \nIf app disabler toggle is enabled, changes take effect immediately.
Block or allow an app\'s mobile data usage. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply changes.
Block or allow an app\'s Wi-Fi data usage. \nToggle Firewall rules to apply changes.
Whitelist an app to bypass the firewall. \nToggle Domain rules to apply changes.
Disable app components (permissions, activities, services, receivers and providers). \nIf app component toggle is enabled, changes take effect immediately.
Only protection level of \'dangerous\' can be disabled. \nDisabling a permission will also disable other permissions from the same group.
Disabling an activity may crash the app. \nIf the disabled activities don\'t appear below, you need to reinstall the app.
Disabling a service may crash the app. \nIf the disabled services don\'t appear below, you need to reinstall the app.
Disabling a receiver may crash the app. \nIf the disabled receivers don\'t appear below, you need to reinstall the app.
Disabling a content provider may crash the app. \nIf the disabled content providers don\'t appear below, you need to reinstall the app.
Backup all settings into a backup file in internal storage.
Restore all settings from a backup file. A \'storage\' permission needs to be granted.
Do you really want to enable all apps?
Do you really want to enable all %1$s?
Do you really want to delete the provider?
Do you really want to delete the domain?
Do you really want to delete the domain or firewall rule?
Do you really want to backup the database and replace any existing backup?
Do you really want to restore the database and replace your entire setup?
Set primary and secondary DNS. \nLeave it empty to restore to default.
Select a hosts file. \nThe file should be located in adhell3 directory and its file name should start with hosts*. \nOnly the first 5 files are listed.
Allow or disallow auto sync for Google accounts.
Allow or disallow sending a crash report to Google.
Allow or disallow backing up to Google servers.
Allow or disallow installation of non-Google-Play applications.
Allow or disallow the camera. Other applications that use the camera cannot use it. It disables the photo camera, video camera, and video telephony functionality.
Allow or disallow microphone. It disables only the microphone used for recording, not the phone application microphone.

Allow or disallow audio recording. The device microphone is still available after disabling audio recording so that the user can make calls and use audio streaming. Video recording is still allowed if no audio recording is attempted.
Allow or disallow video recording. The device camera is still available after disabling video recording so that user can take pictures and use video streaming.
Allow or disallow the usage of USB host storage via USB OTG.
Allow or disallow mobile data connections.
Allow or disallow Wi-Fi access. Wi-Fi Direct and S-Beam features which depend on this policy will also be affected by this setting. Even with disabled Wifi access, Wifi scanning is still possible.
Allow or disallow Bluetooth access. User or third-party applications cannot enable Bluetooth access once it is disabled. Even with disabled Bluetooth access, BLE scanning is still possible.
Allow or disallow the device from sharing its carrier data with another device through USB, WiFi, and Bluetooth.
Allow or disallow any editing functions that require access to the clipboard, including cut, copy, and paste operations.
Allow or disallow sharing the clipboard between applications.
Allow or disallow a user from taking screenshots of the device screen.
Update host providers when enabling domain rules
Protect this app with a password
Enter the password to use this app
If you forget the password, you need to uninstall adhell3.
Create logcat on internal storage for debugging purpose.
Show activation dialog to change the license key.

Adhell3 is merely an app that is using the Samsung Knox SDK APIs. 
 
Script to build apk: 
https://gitlab.com/fusionjack/adhell3-scripts 
 
Source code: 
https://gitlab.com/fusionjack/adhell3 
 
Adhell3 is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.
The apps\' components defined in adhell3_*.txt will be used. \nDo you want to enable or disable those apps\' components?
